TextBody:
Hello Mike,

I apologize for the late reply on this ticket.
Please let me know if we can schedule a remote session in order to investigate if this issue can be reproduced with the latest EPP Server and clients.

Thank you,
Emil


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 7/29/2024 10:03 PM
To: mike.smith@brokertech.co.uk
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #416088 - - Domain Allowlist for CAP doesn't appear to be working [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0DXTLW:ref ]

Hello Mike,

Thank you for the logs.
I will get back to you once the logs will be reviewed by the engineers.

Best regards,
Emil


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Mike Smith [mike.smith@brokertech.co.uk]
Sent: 7/29/2024 4:27 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #416088 - - Domain Allowlist for CAP doesn't appear to be working [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0DXTLW:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000DXTLW:ref



Thanks for your time this afternoon Emil.

Please find attached the diagnostics, logs and example files I tried to upload.

Unfortunately I had to recreate the logs as I switched the client back to "None" debugging mode but in doing so it deleted the log files which I wasn't expecting. I switched debugging back on and tried to upload the files again in the hope of reproducing the problem, which it did.

For reference the domain I was using is our test domain https://quotes.schemeswriter.co.uk/

I think EPP is blocking me from attaching the "dummy.txt" files I used but they were just text files containing 6 or 7 email addresses.

 

Thanks,

 

 

Michael

 

 

 

 

 


On Thu, 25 Jul 2024 at 16:57, Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hello Michael,

I can do Monday at 14:00.
I just sent you a zoom meeting invitation.

Best regards,
Emil

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000DXTLW:ref
 

Hi Emil,

 

Thanks for getting back to me.

Monday might be good if that works for you?

 

Perhaps around 11am? Or 2pm onwards?

 

Thanks,

 

Michael

 


On Thu, 25 Jul 2024 at 16:24, Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hello Michael,

Let me know if we can schedule a remote session for Friday or Monday in order to investigate this.

Thank you,
Emil

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000DXTLW:ref

Hi Emil,

Looks like it is still an issue. We have an allow list set up for our UAT
domain but documents uploaded above the threshold for the CAP policy still
seem to block.
If we could get this fixed or set up correctly it would be greatly
appreciated.

Thanks,

Michael
